However, if the first part (P) is false, the statement does not provide any information about the truth value of the second part (Q). - Original statement: If Sue chose pizza (P), then Bob chose pasta (Q).
- Inverse statement: If Sue did not choose pizza (not P), then Bob did not choose pasta (not Q).
